title: Solvable Lie algebra
summary: In mathematics, a Lie algebra g {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {g}}} is solvable if its derived series terminates in the zero subalgebra. The derived Lie algebra of the Lie algebra g {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {g}}} is the subalgebra of g {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {g}}} , denoted
